Dear Mr. Gonzalez:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please note that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP and
your contract.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.

ALLEGATION:
On 3/22/22, youth had a court hearing and did not like the results. Youth was
destructive towards property and threatening towards a staff member. Video
footage shows a staff member drove around the campus to look for youth. Youth
jumped on staff member's car and staff member drove the car with youth on the
hood.
INVESTIGATION:
A complaint was received on 3/23/22 alleging on 3/22/22, Youth A had a court
hearing and did not like the results. He broke the laptop used for the remote court
hearing and two video monitoring cameras in the room. Youth A threatened to kill his
therapist. Staff 1 was in the room with Youth A at the time. Youth A left and returned
to his unit. While on the unit he broke four additional video monitoring cameras.
The video footage shows, after Youth A left the building, Staff 1 was in his car to
look for Youth A as he could not be seen from the building. Youth A ran toward Staff
1’s car. Staff 1 slowly backed his car away from Youth A, but Youth A jumped on the
hood of the car. Staff 1 continued to slowly back down the hill/road then turned and
left Bethany campus. Staff 1 drove the car with Youth A still on the hood for about
300 yards total. It is unknown how Youth A got off the hood. Youth A did not sustain
any injuries. He did return to campus with a large rock and broke a window to get
into the building and then into a staff office to steal money. Youth A is currently in
detention.
Interviews:
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the county courthouse along with the DHHS
Worker on 3/24/22. Youth A reported he left the facility the previous day due to an
order to detain. He threw a rock through a window and broke into the supervisor’s
office. The facility has a hands-off policy meaning they do not restrain youth so when
he did these things the staff could not do anything. Staff 1 and Staff 2 were both
working when this occurred. Staff 2 told him he could make better choices, but he
was not listening to her. Staff 1 was in his car when Youth A hopped on the hood.
Staff 1 then sped down the road. Youth A did not have any idea where Staff 1 was
going. He was driving on the campus road then onto the main road. Youth A was on
the car the entire time. He was on the hood of car for about 10-15 minutes and the
car was moving the entire time. Youth A told Staff 1 to stop the car, but he wouldn't.
Prior to this Staff 1 had called the police on Youth A because he was destroying
3

everything. He tried to talk to Staff 1 but Staff 1 jumped in his car and locked the
doors. Staff 1 flipped Youth A off and that is why Youth A jumped on his car. Youth A
was mad and yelling at Staff 1 but he wanted to talk. After he got off Staff 1's car,
Youth A grabbed a rock so he could get back into the facility. Prior to this Youth A
had destroyed the cameras and a laptop. Youth A reported he has not done
anything like this before. He was upset because during a court hearing his therapist
was making him sound like a “monster”. She said he was out of school for an entire
week, but he was not. She said he stole things. He did take another youth's coat and
shoes, but they should not have taken his stuff. During the court hearing he called
his therapist a “B” and said, “If you want a monster, I will show you a monster.” No
one tried to stop him. Youth A stated he did not feel safe at the facility because he
had to worry if the staff were going to be respectful or not.
The Clinical Supervisor (CS) and Program Supervisor (PS) were interviewed face to
face at the facility on 3/24/22 along with the DHHS Worker. CS reported Staff 1 will
be put on leave. Supervisor is handling the details. CS stated he became aware of
the car incident the morning after it occurred, however he was at the facility when it
occurred. The following day PS watched the video after Staff 2 told him what
happened. PS reported Staff 1's direct supervisor had previously questioned some
of Staff 1's decisions as she felt they were emotionally driven. Staff 1 takes it
personally when the youth do not succeed.
CS said they knew Youth A would have a reaction from the court hearing. They did
not know it would have been this severe. Youth A has run away from the facility
several times and that is what they thought would happen. After the incident the
police took Youth A to the hospital. He was supposed to be taken to detention from
the hospital, but that did not happen. Youth A came back to the facility and was kept
separate from the other youth with a one-on-one staff until he was picked up and
taken to detention the following day.
CS was interviewed again face to face at the facility on 4/4/22. He reported during
the incident with Youth A he did not know Youth A was on the unit. He thought Youth
A left the building. Staff 1 was not telling them what was actually going on or what
was needed. Due to some broken cameras, they could not always see where Youth
A was, and they were all still participating in the court hearing. CS stated he had
called the police prior to Staff 1 even asking and called again when they had not
shown up fast enough.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 3/24/22 along with the DHHS
Worker. The morning of 3/22/22 Youth A refused to go to school. Youth A and Youth
B were going to play video games all day. The youth went around the unit taking
video equipment and video games. At 3pm the second shift came in. The third staff
was late so Staff 2 stayed to cover. She met with Youth A's therapist and CS to talk
about what they would do regarding Youth A's court hearing. Their plan was to have
Youth A in a room by himself where he could not have access to anything he could
destroy. They locked all the other doors and locked down the elevator so the only
4

place he could go without staff assistance was outside. Staff 1 went with Youth A to
the recovery room for his court hearing. Youth A had known he had something that
day, but he did not know what it was. The rest of the group went to a different
location for therapy. Youth B did not want to be in group, so he was brought back to
the unit and took a shower. Staff 2 stayed on the unit with Youth B. She watched the
camera footage of Youth A while he was in his court hearing. She saw Youth A and
Staff 1 in the room. She could tell Youth A was becoming agitated. Youth A then
threw the laptop and busted the camera that was in the room. A few minutes later
Youth A entered the unit. Staff 2 stated Staff 1 would have had to let Youth A into
the unit. Youth A became upset with another peer who was not on the unit, so he
threw the peers belongings all over. Youth A tried breaking several cameras on the
unit. Staff 1 then left the unit. Youth B was still in the shower. Staff 2 went to the
other unit to get the Assistant Supervisor who called the police. Youth A saw Staff 1
outside on his phone, so he ran outside. Staff 1 got into his car and backed out of his
parking sport. Youth A then jumped on Staff 1's hood. Staff 1 sped off down the
driveway then down the street toward the cross street. At the stop sign Youth A got
off of Staff 1's car. Youth A came back to the facility followed by Staff 1 in his car.
Youth A took a large rock and used it to break a window leading to the unit dining
room. He pushed the glass out with his hand and entered the unit. Youth B was out
of the shower and in the living room area when Youth A came in. Staff 2 left the unit
with Youth B because it was not safe. The following day Staff 2 talked to PS about
the incident.
Youth A's therapist (Therapist) was interviewed face to face at the facility on 3/24/22
along with the DHHS Worker. Therapist stated she was present in the court hearing
by video from her office. Youth A became upset because she told the truth. She told
the court Youth A was out of school a total of a week as he had missed two days
one week and three days the next. He also was not participating in treatment,
engaging peers in negative behaviors, and stapled his ear to pierce it. When Youth
A became upset, he started to pace and yell. He kicked the computer then slammed
it against the wall. Staff 1 was in the room with Youth A. She then saw Youth A
break a camera. She had the camera open on one of her monitors and the court
hearing on the other. Youth A said, “F you” to Therapist. After the court hearing was
disconnected due to the broken laptop Therapist could no longer hear what Youth A
was saying. Staff 1 then texted Therapist and told her Youth A was threatening her
life. After the camera was broken and she could no longer see anything, Staff 1
came to her office to say that Youth A had gotten into the elevator and onto his unit.
She reported the elevator was supposed to be locked down. Youth A then destroyed
the cameras on the unit and left the building. Staff 1 then left her office to go follow
Youth A. Therapist saw Staff 1 follow Youth A in his car. She did not see Youth A on
the hood of Staff 1's car but she was on the phone with Staff 1 when he reported
Youth A jumped onto his car. She reported she was on and off the phone with Staff
1 throughout the incident. She then saw Youth A hitting the unit window with a rock
and broke it. Youth A entered the unit and went to the supervisor’s office. He broke
the camera so she could no longer see what he was doing on the unit. She then saw
Youth A run to the east of the building where he was caught by the police. While
5

she was on the phone with Staff 1 and Youth A was on his car Staff 1 told her Youth
A had a butterknife and was hitting his windshield with it.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 4/4/22 along with the DHHS
Worker. He reported Youth A was sitting in the room talking about stealing Staff 1's
car and the items in it. He was saying these things prior to court starting. Court
started and Youth A became upset about what Therapist was saying about school.
Youth A called Therapist the "B" word. He then began to pace the room. Youth A
swore again after Therapist stated it was hard to help someone without having
rapport with them. The Judge told Youth A not to swear. Therapist continued to talk
about Youth A's behaviors at the facility and Youth A then began to stomp on the
laptop. Youth A said he was going to kill Therapist. He then broke the camera in the
room. Staff 1 texted Therapist and told her Youth A threatened her life. Youth A
picked up the laptop and threw it against the wall. Staff 1 stated there was a plan
prior to the court hearing because they knew Youth A would act out. They put him on
the middle floor in a room where he could only access the outside. They locked
down the elevator so Youth A could not get to the unit. Youth A walked toward the
elevator which was stopped on the floor he was on and open. As Youth A went into
the open elevator Staff 1 went to talk to Therapist. Youth A was in the elevator by
himself, but the camera could see him. Staff 1 saw on the camera footage on his
phone Youth A managed to get to the unit where Staff 2 and Youth B were. Staff 1
went to the unit and reported to Staff 2 what was going on. Staff 1 went to tell the CS
and Therapist, who were together in one room, to call the police. Staff 1 said he had
a good relationship with Youth A and he tried to talk Youth A down prior to him
getting into the elevator. Staff 1 reported Youth B was in the shower when he got to
the unit. Staff 1 and Staff 2 talked to Youth A while he was on the unit. Youth A then
took a peer’s belongings from his room and destroyed them. Staff 1 went back to CS
and Therapist to make sure they called the police. He did not feel they were doing
anything about what was happening. When he saw CS and Therapist, they were
watching Youth A by camera and in the court hearing. They told Staff 1 a pickup
order was in place. Staff 1 said that was not reassuring to him. He felt the situation
was not being handled by the others, so he called the police himself. Staff 1 went
outside, and Youth A followed asking him what he was doing. Youth A had
something in his hand and Staff 1 thought it was a knife. Youth A tried to use the
knife to open the door to get back in the building. Staff 1 did not feel safe standing
out in the open while Youth A had a knife, so he got into his car and pulled out of his
parking spot. He locked his car doors. He called Therapist and police to give them
an update. The Assistant Supervisor (AS) came out and talked to Staff 1 asking why
he was in his car. While they were talking Youth A walked up to the car. AS told Staff
1 to hold tight. Staff 1 said he was a nervous reck and scared of what Youth A would
do. Staff 1 then backed up his car and Youth A jumped on it. Staff 1 was on the
phone with Therapist at the time. Youth A was punching the windshield and using
the butt of the knife to hit it. Staff 1 was unsure where AS went. He “freaked out” and
back the car up, turned and then drove away. He was still talking to Therapist, and
she told him to stop. He stopped and Youth A got off his car, grabbed a rock and
threw it at his car. Staff 1 said he got into his car because Youth A was between him
6

and the building. Staff 1 said he thought he was going about 5 miles per hour while
Youth A was on the car. Staff 1 said Youth A never told him to stop. He thinks he
went about 300-400 meters. When he watched the video of the incident it did not
look like 5 miles per hour, he thought it looked a little faster. Staff 1 said he was
concerned he would get stabbed by Youth A. He has dealt with escalated youth
before just not to this severity. It was different because Youth A had a knife. He did
not have a clue where Youth A got the knife. Sharp knives are locked up and butter
knives were put behind the staff desk so the youth would not make food when they
were not supposed to. Staff 1 said he had concerns about being left alone with
Youth A when they knew he would act out. He asked them to call the police and
have one on standby, but they would not do that. After Youth A got off the car Staff 1
was told to follow Youth A. Staff 1 followed Youth A back up to the facility. Once at
the facility Youth A grabbed a big rock and threw it at the unit window. The facility let
other staff leave when they needed them to help with this situation.
The Assistant Supervisor (AS) was interviewed face to face at the facility on 4/4/22
along with the DHHS Worker. She reported she was working on the other unit when
she was notified by Staff 2 and Therapist to call 911. She reported they came to her
in person at once. Youth A was on the unit. Staff 1 went outside. Staff 2 told AS
Youth A was upset because he thought Staff 1 called the police. AS asked what
Staff 1 was doing outside and Staff 2 did not know. Youth A then went outside and
AS went out shortly after. Youth A was walking around outside. She went to see
what Staff 1 was doing. Staff 1 ran to his car and got inside. Staff 1's car was facing
the building when she approached it. Staff 1 had his phone in his hand talking to
someone (she later found out it was Therapist). Youth A then walked toward Staff 1's
car and she walked back to the building. She did not see that Youth A had anything
in his hand. Youth A was angry and yelling at her to open the door to the facility. She
did not know where Youth A was when she was talking to Staff 1. Once she was
inside, she heard Therapist say, "What? He is on your car?" AS then went to the
window to look out. She saw Youth A on top of Staff 1's car hood. Staff 1 was driving
about 15-20 mph going forward before the stop sign at the cross streets. Staff 1
stopped at the stop sign at the cross streets. Youth A got off and Staff 1 turned left.
She then walked away and did not see Youth A pick up anything. She did not see
the video of the incident.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on 4/13/22. He did not report any
concerns.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage of the incident was provided by PS and viewed at the facility on
3/24/22. Video 1 is of the parking lot looking away from the facility. AS is seen
approaching a silver car (PS indicates the car is Staff 1's). As AS approaches Staff
1's car is pulling up the drive toward the facility. AS walks up to Staff 1’s car then
walks away. Youth A comes into view and Staff 1 begins to back up. Youth A jumps
on the hood of Staff 1's car and hits the windshield. Staff 1 continues to back up
down the drive. Staff 1 backs up into a driveway. Staff 1 then pulls out of the
7

driveway going forward down the side street. Youth A remains on the car as Staff 1
drives.
A second video shows the parking lot of the building in front of the facility. Staff 1's
car is seen with Youth A still on the hood driving forward passing the building and
continuing into the neighborhood.
While at the facility on 3/24/22 the location of the incident was viewed. On the south
side of the facility is the staff parking lot. At the end of the parking lot and to the east
is a drive leading to the rest of campus. Going south past the drive, leaving campus,
there is a building on the east side of the street. This building is the location of the
second video. Continuing south on this street is a neighborhood leading to a cross
street with a stop sign. The distance from the facility to the stop sign was measured
to be .2 miles on this consultant’s odometer.
Documents Reviewed:
 Youth A’s case file in MiSACWIS was reviewed. Youth A was admitted to the
facility on 9/3/21 and was discharged to detention on 3/23/22. Youth A was
receiving sexual offender treatment but was not taking responsibility for the
offense. Youth A is resistant to treatment. He is oppositional and defiant. He
has a history of self-harm, suicidal ideation, and running away.
 Driver Acknowledgement of Policy: states staff agree to fully comply with
current and future laws and ordinances governing the operation and storage
of motor vehicles.
 Vehicles Use, Safety, Maintenance and Accident Policy and Procedure: safe
transportation of youth will be provided through appropriate vehicle use and
compliance with safety standards. All state traffic laws will be followed. This
applies to all staff that use agency, rental or personal vehicles for facility
business.
 Incident Reports: All Incident Reports were written by Staff 2 and matched the
information provided in her interview.
 Staff 1 employee file: Staff 1 was hired on 1/18/21. He had no discipline
records. He signed the driver acknowledgement on 1/18/21. He received CPI
training on 3/24/21 and Special De-escalation/Safety planning on 3/2/22.
A DHHS Case Conference was attended on 4/22/22 and the DHHS Worker reported
she has a preponderance of evidence.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to requirements; staff
qualifications.
(4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the
following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
(b) Experience to perform the duties of the position
assigned.
8

ANALYSIS: Staff 1 drove his car with Youth A on the hood. This behavior
demonstrates that Staff 1 does not have the ability or
experience to perform his duties. The DHHS worker had a
finding of improper supervision.
Technical Assistance:
All staff need to be made aware of your new cell phone policy. A
working phone always needs to be available for emergencies.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
ADDITIONAL FINDINGS:
Staff left youth unsupervised.
INVESTIGATION:
Interviews:
The Clinical Supervisor (CS) was interviewed face to face at the facility on 3/24/22
and 4/4/22. He reported the facility is an open residential treatment facility for youth
with sexual behaviors. There are 11 boys on Youth A’s unit. They have a ratio of five
youth to one staff. CS stated the units have phones on them and they would have
been in working order on 3/22/22. The staff can utilize their personal cell phones in
an emergency, but cell service can be spotty on the units.
During Staff 2’s interview on 3/24/22 she reported during the incident on 3/22/22
Staff 1 told Staff 2 he would be right back and left the unit. She did not know where
he went. She was the only staff on the unit. Youth A became upset with another peer
who was not on the unit, so he threw the peers belongings all over. Youth A tried
breaking several cameras on the unit. Staff 1 then left the unit. Youth B was still in
the shower. Staff 2 went to the other unit to get the Assistant Supervisor who called
the police. Staff 2 reported she was only gone about 30 seconds. The unit did not
have a working phone and she did not think of using her cell phone. Youth B was
still in the shower when she returned. She reported it was possible for Youth A to
enter the shower while Youth B was in there, but she did not think he did. Based on
Staff
During Therapists interview on 3/24/22 she reported Staff 1 came to her office to
inform her Youth A had got into the elevator and onto his unit. Therapist stated Staff
1 went to her office initially because he tried calling her and he could not get through
on the phone. She did not know who was on the unit when Staff 1 came to see her.
Staff 1 stated during his interview on 4/4/22 he texted Therapist while Youth A was
still in the room and told her Youth A threatened her life. As Youth A went into the
open elevator Staff 1 went to talk to Therapist. Youth A was in the elevator by
himself, but the camera could see him. Staff 1 left Youth A on the unit with Staff 2
and Youth B to go tell CS and Therapist, who were together in one room, to call the
9

police. Staff 1 reported they had shut the phones down on the unit so the youth
could not call whomever and whenever they wanted. He could not call anyone on his
cell phone because they have a no cell phone policy. Staff 1 stated it depends on
the kid if they can leave them alone while escalated or leave them with one staff. He
stated there is usually only one staff dealing with an escalated youth. After Staff 1
went back to the unit Youth A was destroying other youths belongings so Staff 1 left
again to tell CS and Therapist to call the police. He did not think they were taking it
serious enough, so he went outside to call the police. Staff 1 said he was previously
disciplined for using his cell phone when he was not supposed to.
AS was interviewed face to face at the facility on 4/4/22. She reported she was on a
different unit when Staff 2 came to her in person to tell her to call the police. AS did
not know who was on the unit with Youth A. She then saw Staff 1 go outside. AS
said, it is not typical to leave one staff alone with an escalated youth. They can use
the landline or their cell phone to call for help. They are allowed to use their cell
phones for work purposes only.
Tour Observation:
A tour of the unit was provided on 3/24/22. There were two landlines on the unit, one
on the staff desk and one in the kitchen. Both were in working order and the desk
phone was able to call this consultant’s cell phone. The unit doors are self-closing
doors. The entrance to the other unit was also a self-closing door and was directly
opposite Youth A’s unit door. Staff 2 was present for the tour, she said both doors
closed behind her when she left the unit to get help. She also stated the phones had
been removed because they were afraid the youth would destroy them.
Documentation reviewed:
 Staff 1’s employee file did not have a discipline for using his cell phone.
 Staff 2’s employee file indicated she has no disciplinary record. She received
CPI training on 11/9/20 and Special De-escalation/Safety Planning on
3/24/22.
 Staff Cell Phone Policy: personal cell phones can only be used as a service to
the treatment program or as a safety measure which includes asking for
assistance.
 Youth Specialist Job Description: “The residential treatment program is
committed to providing the highest quality care and supervision to the youth
being served.”
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4126 Sufficiency of staff.
The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these
administrative rules and in the agency's program statement and
to provide for the continual needs, protection, and supervision of
residents.
10

ANALYSIS: The facility did not have sufficient staff to supervise the youth
when Staff 1 left Youth A alone in the elevator, when Youth A
was escalated Staff 1 left him alone on the unit with Staff 2 and
Youth B, and when Staff 2 left Youth A who was escalated alone
on the unit with Youth B.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
It is recommended upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan no change
be made to the license status of this child caring institution.
